com.inqwell.any.channel

Interface ChannelDriver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Any, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractChannelDriver, FIFO, HttpTunnel, RMI, Serialize, Socket, WriteCopy

    public interface ChannelDriver
extends Any
    A channel driver defines the operational semantics of a channel. Implementations of the ChannelDriver interface are passed to a channel on the channel's construction. Such implementations define the type of exchange for the channel, such as a memory buffer, io stream etc.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        Any read()
  throws AnyException
        Read an object from this ChannelDriver. Returns the object available in the exchange, null if the channel is empty and would not block or InputChannel.shutdown__ for the next read performed after shutdownInput has been called.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • write

        void write(Any a)
    throws AnyException
        Write an object to the exchange
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Test if the exchange has any objects to read
        Returns:
        true if the exchange is empty; false otherwise.

      • isFull

        boolean isFull()
        Test if the exchange is capable of accepting objects to write
        Returns:
        true if the exchange cannot accept an object at this time; false otherwise.

      • canShutdown

        boolean canShutdown()
        Test if the exchange is in a state where it can be shutdown. Some exchanges may, for example, enforce that they are empty before allowing shutdown, to avoid lost messages

      • close

        void close()
    throws AnyException
        Close this exchange. After calling this method the exchange may no longer accept read and write requests. If purge is true the implementation may attempt to discard any input waiting to be read, depending on its ability to do so.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • purgeReceived

        void purgeReceived()

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()

      • setKeepOpen

        void setKeepOpen(boolean keepOpen)

      • isKeepOpen

        boolean isKeepOpen()
        Reports whether this ChannelDriver will try to keep itself open under exceptional conditions detected in the exchange mechanism. Generally, this property of the driver is determined automatically.

      • setProbeTimeout

        void setProbeTimeout(long timeout)

      • getProbeTimeout

        long getProbeTimeout()

      • getSocket

        Socket getSocket()

      • isBlocking

        boolean isBlocking()
        Returns true if this driver can block on read operations, or false if it would never block

      • reOpen

        boolean reOpen()
        throws AnyException
        If possible, attempt to reopen this ChannelDriver.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • canReopen

        boolean canReopen()
        Can this channel driver be reopened?

      • shutdownInput

        void shutdownInput()
            throws AnyException
        Shutdown this channel driver's read operation. Causes the exchange to return InputChannel.shutdown__ in a subsequent read operation.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • resetOutput

        ChannelDriver resetOutput(ChannelDriver d)
                   throws AnyException
        Reset this channel driver's write operation. The new channel driver may be subsumed into this channel driver, or this channel driver may choose to create and return a new driver altogther.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • flushOutput

        void flushOutput()
          throws AnyException
        Perform any operation required to complete any output pending on this channel driver.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • drainInput

        If possible, drain any pending input this channel driver has waiting for the next reader
